courseTitle: Simplified Radiographic Anatomy and Physiology - PART 1
courseDescription: This course provides a simplified yet comprehensive overview of radiographic anatomy and physiology, designed for medical imaging students, radiographers, and general practitioners. It covers the essential anatomical structures and their relationships within the human body, focusing on the basic physiological mechanisms and their radiological appearances.
courseObjectives: Identify different types of medical imaging modalities.
Identify the radiographic appearance of different types of tissues on x-ray images.
Identify the regional terms of the different parts of the human body.
List the regions of the Abdomen.
Describe the ventral and dorsal cavities of the body.
List the board categories of tissues.
List the main functions of the epithelial tissue.
Classify the epithelial tissue according to the shape and number of cell layers.
List the characteristic components of connective tissues.
Identify the main types of connective tissue
List the main functions of connective tissues
List the functions of the skeletal system.
Identify the functions of the Axial Skeleton.
Identify the functions of the Appendicular Skeleton.
List the components of the Axial Skeleton.
Identify the anatomical parts of long bone.
Identify the structural components of the Bone.
List the Bones of the cranial base.
Identify the Foramina of the cranial base.
Identify the function of the vertebral column
Identify the anatomical structure of vertebra
List the curvatures of the Vertebral Column
Identify the anatomical components of Atlas and Axis.
Identify the anatomical components of Intervertebral discs
List the joints and ligaments of the vertebral column
Differentiate between Typical and Atypical Ribs.
Differentiate between True, False and floating Ribs.
Identify the anatomical components of the Scapula.
Identify the function of the clavicle.
Identify the regions of the clavicle.
Identify the anatomical divisions of the upper limb
Identify anatomical components of the humerus.
Identify anatomical components of the radius and ulna.
Identify anatomical structure of each carpal bone.
Identify the anatomical structure of upper limb phalanges.
List the anatomical components of shoulder joint.
List the anatomical components of elbow joint.
Identify the anatomical components of the Proximal and distal radio-ulnar joints.
Identify the anatomical components of the Wrist joint.
Identify the anatomical components of Metacarpophalangeal and Interphalangeal joints.
List the anatomical components of the hip bone.
Identify the anatomical components of ilium.
Identify the anatomical components of pubis.
Identify the anatomical components of ischium.
Identify the anatomical divisions of the lower limb
Identify anatomical components of the femur.
Identify anatomical components of the tibia and fibula.
Identify anatomical structure of each tarsal l bone.
Identify the anatomical structure of lower limb phalanges.
List the anatomical components of hip joint.
Identify the anatomical classification of knee joint.
List the anatomical components of knee joint.
Identify the anatomical components of the Proximal and distal tibiofibular joints.
Identify the anatomical components of the ankle joint.
Identify the anatomical components of subtalar joint.

modules.title: Module 1: General Principles and Anatomical Terminology
modules.description: Introduction to the basic concepts of anatomy and physiology, including medical imaging principles and anatomical terminology.
objectives: Identify different types of medical imaging modalities.
Identify the radiographic appearance of different types of tissues on x-ray image.
Identify the basic principle of CT scan imaging
Describe the different types of CT scan windows.
Identify the basic principle of MR imaging.
Differentiate between T1; T2 and Proton density weighted MR Images.

modules.description: Introduction to the basic concepts of anatomy and physiology, including medical imaging principles and anatomical terminology.
objectives: Identify the regional terms of the different parts of the human body.
List the regions of the Abdomen.
Describe the ventral and dorsal cavities of the body.

modules.title: Module 2: Body Tissues, Skeletal System, Skull, Vertebral Column and Thoracic Cage
modules.description: Detailed study of body tissues, the skeletal system, the skull, the vertebral column and the thoracic cage.

List the characteristic components of connective tissues.
Identify the main types of connective tissue.
List the main functions of connective tissues.
List the functions of the skeletal system.
Identify the functions of the Axial Skeleton.
